item.title: Report E-2023060419
item.description:
Report E-2023060419

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-23T00:39:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCO experienced a release from a 2050-pound battery due to the battery falling off of the pallet. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and securement of the freight. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to a 20' x 5' area of the concrete dock floor due to the battery falling off the pallet. Acid Gator and absorbent pads were utilized to clean the release and wiped down the pallet and battery. The battery was secured and wrapped onto the pallet. All waste was containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: CINCINNATI

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCN experienced a release from (2) 1012-pound UN2794 Battery, Wet, Filled with Acid. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 8-gallons of product released to a 10' x 8' area of the trailer floor, a 10' x 15' area of the dock floor, and a 20' x 4' area of the concrete lot below due to the batteries falling over in transit. Soda ash and absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All cleanup debris was placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The batteries were secured onto a pallet. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023060136
item.description:
Report E-2023060136

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-23T00:39:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-05
  • City: WALBRIDGE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 4, 2023, at 1915 hours, personnel in the CSXT Walbridge, OH Yard discovered a strong odor emitting from CPCX 205191, a residue tank car of Combustible Liquid, N.O.S. The car was isolated and the shipper, Lubrizol, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2023-0605-00294). EnviroServe, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the odor was emitting from a faulty Vacuum Relief Valve (VRV). The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative- Joe Eskra (440-364-9372, joe.eskra@lubrizol.com). Contractor personnel removed the faulty VRV and secured the opening with a pipe plug. The car was held at the CSX Walbridge yard pending a One Time Movement Approval (OTMA) from the FRA.

item.title: Report E-2023050168
item.description:
Report E-2023050168

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-23T00:39:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-02
  • City: MARION
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 5/02/2023, at 0308, personnel on the CSXT Main Line Columbus subdivision at mile post CD46.2 discovered VTGX 17533, a loaded tank car of Phosphoric Acid Solution, leaking from the Bottom Outlet Valve (BOV). The car was isolated and the shipper, Brenntag Global Marketing, National Response Center (NRC) incident #1366153, and local Fire and Police departments were notified (CHEMTREC Report #2023050200021). James Courtney, CSX Manager of Hazardous Materials, and EnviroServe and Arcadis, both CSXT emergency response contractors, were dispatched to the scene and found VTGX 17533 actively leaking. The issue was identified as a defective BOV valve with an unsecure secondary closure and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper (D.E. Duke 484-793-5119). Contractor personnel installed a new 2-inch plug in the BOV secondary closure cap after discovering the original plug was unserviceable and remediation efforts of the impacted area began immediately. The leak was secured and the car was moved to the CSXT Marion Yard for offloading, tank cleaning, and prep for Home Shop. Upon onloading it was discovered that the BOV operating handle was properly actuating the BOV; causing the valve to remain open while the BOV operating handle was in the closed position.

item.description:
Report E-2023060354

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-23T00:39:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-25
  • City: NORWALK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 25, 2023, four (4) aerosol cans of paint related material were damaged due to a load shift and released approximately three (3) pints of product to the product packaging. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. FCE personnel overpacked the damaged cans in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The crew then utilized absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. All paint related material was collected in the same one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023060306
item.description:
Report E-2023060306

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-23T00:39:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-24
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 24, 2023, eight (8) pails of UN1139 were damaged during loading and released approximately twelve (12) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the release and worked them in using hand tools. The crews then utilized absorbent pads and degreasing solution to wipe down all impacted surfaces. TLE containerized all spent absorbents and the damaged eight (8) pails into three (3) 55-gallon metal drums for disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered on the load end emitting an odor. Box was taken to the Hazmat Cage and placed under the ventilator. Upon inspection, with nitrile gloves, white dust was discovered coating the inside of the package and released from the box through handle hole if the package was moved. Dust was collecting in the bottom of the box. DescribePack: All three bottles of trichloroisocyanuric acid were leaking powder from a faulty seal around the top of each of the bottles. DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately, upon discovery, separated and put in a salvage drum and set under ventilation.

item.description:
Report E-2023060240

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-23T00:39:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-11
  • City: WEST UNITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ACTION RESOURCES, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Truck and Van trailer with waste load of metal drums was in route from UT to NY. Driver had stopped at a service plaza in West Unity OH for a rest break. Driver performed a walk around and noticed a drip coming out of the trailer. The local authorities were notified. The Police and Fire Department responded to the scene. The Fire Department placed a containment pool under the drip coming from the trailer. An emergency response crew were also dispatched to the scene to determine the cause of the leak and perform the clean up and remediation. It was determined that 6 drums were leaking inside the trailer. The drums were placed in overpacks. The load was transported on to destination. The small amount of product that reached the ground was cleaned up and disposed of properly.

  • Description: On May 17, 2023, one (1) 500-gallon tote of printing ink was leaking at the weld due to faulty packaging and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents and worked them in using hand tools. The crew collected all impacted absorbents into one (1) 5-gallon pail. FCE then transferred the virgin product in the 500-gallon drum into one (1) 330-gallon tote.

  • City: RICHFIELD

  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-1ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that six (6) gallons of material was released from fifteen (15) 1-gallon plastic jugs due to the freight shifting during transit. First Call Environmental personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and then swept up the spent material. The damaged jugs and spent absorbents were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilizing. The undamaged product was sent on to the consignee. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived to QA, and I noticed the box being black on its transit over. As soon as I realized it was damaged and leaked through the box, I went to the storage cage and grabbed a 10 gallon drum. I wore a pair of latex gloves and put the damaged package into a bag that i lined in the drum. I Immediately put the lid on and sealed it shut. DescribePack: The box looked crushed. Upon further inspection, one of the bottles was crushed into the other. The damaged bottles cap was barely on. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Quickly removed the hazmat from pallet it arrived on and put it into a hazmat drum.

item.title: Report E-2023050490
item.description:
Report E-2023050490

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-23T00:39:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-01
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While offloading containers at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Dayton, OH a Veolia employee noticed the container he was unloading had a slow leak from the bottom. Veolia employees set the drum down and placed spill pads around the bottom while we further investigated the material and condition of the container. The investigation showed that the container had a significant leak when we tried to move it to its side or lift it for over packing. The container leak slowed down when we placed the drum flat on its bottom. We decided to try to overpack the container by placing it on its side and quickly sliding an 85 gallon over pack over the bottom of the drum. Ideally the overpack would catch most of the material that leaked out of the drum while we attempted the overpacking process. Unfortunately the drum totally failed as we placed it on its side allowing most of the material inside to flow into the trailer. Spill dry and spill pads were already placed in the area so the spill was contained at the time of release. The initial spill was a few gallons but once the bottom split/cracked an additional 35 gallons was released. The spilled material was cleaned up using floor dry/cat litter and the area was decontaminated. All spill clean up material was properly cleaned up by the Veolia team and we confirmed that no material released outside of the trailer.

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-20
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On April 20, 2023, four (4) one-gallon containers of UN1789 were damaged during transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted surface. FCE personnel deployed a neutralizing agent to the floor, followed by granular absorbents. The crew overpacked the damaged containers in one (1) 55-gallon drum. FCE then utilized hand tools to collect and containerize all UN1789 impacted absorbents in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On April 5, 2023, three (3) one-gallon containers of HD Oven and Grill Cleaner were punctured during transit and released approximately three gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted surface. ES personnel deployed soda ash to the released material and utilized hand tools to collect and containerize all HD Oven and Grill Cleaner impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The crew then utilized absorbent wipes to continue remediating the area. All impacted debris, PPE, and other clean up materials were placed in the previously mentioned 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023040244
item.description:
Report E-2023040244

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-23T00:39:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-08
  • City: Mingo Junction
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: WHEELING & LAKE ERIE RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At about 1300 hrs. on 4-8-2013, the WLE Mingo Yard Car Inspector heard a hissing sound coming from on top of car PROX 47110 and he was also able to smell a petroleum odor. He notified the Mingo Yard Yardmaster who then called myself, John Vergis, Hazardous Materials Officer for the WLE. The Yardmaster told me that the car inspector was going to get into contact with the shipper since they were just a few minutes up the road. Randy Mitchell from Tidewater Logistics, Phone number 817-602-4898, called to tell me that they were there looking at the car and after he described where the noise was coming from, we determined that the vacuum relief valve was defective and causing pressure to leave the tank. They had no way of mitigating the leak so I called Specialized Professional Services out of Washington, PA to come out and look at the car. We were not able to plug the valve because it was a flanged type device. SPSI took thick rubber gloves and covered the valve and then secured the gloves to the valve with pipe clamps. SPSI then was in communication with the car owner so that we could confirm the proper valve that needs to go back on the car. As of the date of this report, the car is still not repaired but we are monitoring this car daily to make sure it is no longer leaking. This car will be repaired on site and then released into transportation.

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-05
  • City: MORAINE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Univar Solutions USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Poly 275 gal tote fell from the forks while attempting to be placed on top of another tote. The poly tote burst and the contents released onto the warehouse floor. The cause was from the bottom of top tote catching the bottom tote metal cage while repositioning. The tote was caught and when top tote (that fell) was raised, the brought up the bottom tote. Then the bottom tote fell and broke the bottom of top tote's pallet causing the tote to fall. The waste profile B155-0631 shipping description Glycol Ether Universal Waste was contained in the warehouse. Clean up was completed 4/6/2023. The clean up resulted in a total of 8 drums (7 -55 gallon and 1- 85 gallon).

item.title: Report E-2023040124
item.description:
Report E-2023040124

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-23T00:39:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-05
  • City: LORDSTOWN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XAY experienced a UN2428 "RE/GEN CC-45" release from a 30-gallon poly drum due to improper packaging. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to an 8’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor and a 2’ x 3’ area to the asphalt yard underneath the trailer. Crew found that the threading on the drum cap was damaged. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. All impacted pallet wood was placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The impacted absorbents and PPE were placed into a separate 55-gallon poly drum. All lids and bung caps were vented as precaution. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On March 13, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote containing UN1760 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 230-gallons of product to the trailer floor, concrete parking lot, and adjacent cargo. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. TLE personnel transferred the contents of the damaged tote into one (1) new 275-gallon tote for continued shipping. The crew then utilized absorbents, degreasing agent, and hand tools to collect and containerize all UN1760 impacted material in thirty five (35) 35-gallon drums for disposal. All undamaged cargo was wiped down and repalletized for continued shipment.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SET Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft-by-6ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that ten (10) pounds of material was released. SET Environmental personnel searched the pallet of fifty (50) pound bags and could not locate the leaking bag. SET Environmental stated that the damaged bag was already removed from the trailer. The contractor swept up released material and placed it into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. SET Environmental restacked the bags onto the pallet to be forwarded on to the consignee. The waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilizing. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023030783
item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-14
  • City: MANSFIELD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: EnviroServe was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an 8ft-by-40ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that less than five (5) gallons of material was released. EnviroServe personnel stated that the metal drum had become damaged during transit due to improper securement of the cargo that resulted in a crease at the bottom of the metal drum. The damaged drum was overpacked into an 85-gallon metal drum. EnviroServe personnel cleaned the impacted area, gathered the impacted cardboard, and placed the cleanup debris into two (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilizing. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2023030588

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-09
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 09, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3264 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 15-gallons of product to the trailer floor and asphalt parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the site. TLE personnel patched the impacted drum then utilized a 95-gallon overpack to contain the damaged 55-gallon drum. The crew then utilized absorbents, degreaser, and hand tools to remediate the surface, then containerized all UN3264-impacted material in four (4) 35-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023030388
item.description:
Report E-2023030388

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-16
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO contacted ERTS to report that there had been a 20-ounce spill of UN1814 "Clean-R-235" potassium hydroxide, a solution that was released from one 275-gallon plastic tote. XPO stated that the material impacted the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched a contractor to complete cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-cups of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the trailer floor which had evaporated. The tote appeared to be damaged due to a forklift puncture. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Soda ash was deployed to clean and neutralize the trailer floor. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with cleanup debris into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On March 06, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon container containing UN1760 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. FCE personnel utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to remove any product and containerized all waste into one (1) 35-gallon poly drum for transport and disposal.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAY experienced a release from a 240-pound fiberboard drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to completed cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released to a 4' x 4' area of the dock floor from a 240-pound fiberboard drum due to a puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged drum and all impacted absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2/17/2023, at approximately 0630, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5101437 at the station location in Cincinnati, reporting a ethanol spill. The shipment consisted of two (2) jeerican cans, one of which appeared to have been punctured. During loading, the courier discovered the jerrican with the AWB# ending in -6049 had a puncture in the body of the container, resulting in a leakage. The cause of the damage is unknown. A spill specialist conatined the spill by placing the damage jerrican in a salvage drum and cleaning the leakage. The spillage did not escape into the delivery vehicle. The unharried jerrican was successfully delivered. The damaged drum awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-06
  • City: DELAWARE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ONEH2, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Our driver was traveling Hwy 23 when a driver made a left hand turn in front of him running a red light. Our driver did not have time to take evasive action and struck the car on the passenger side head on. This caused our driver to veer off the road and the front of the trailer struck the traffic light pole and the trailer became disconnected from the truck. The packaging of the hydrogen cylinders shifted forward and struck the front of the trailer. A fire started immediately and the TPRD (Temperature and Pressure Relief Devices on each cylinder began to release. The vents release hydrogen into an area that was already on fire. The intrinsically safe systems that we have in place did what they were supposed to to release the gas to prevent further damage.

item.title: Report E-2023020464
item.description:
Report E-2023020464

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-20
  • City: HAMILTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 21, 2023, at 1540 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner Transportation Systems (RRTS) personnel in Hamilton Ohio regarding the release of approximately 2 gallons of Techno Adhesives #106 Spray Insulation Adhesive (Adhesives, containing flammable liquid, UN1133, 3, II) from (1) 55-gallon metal drum, reportedly due to a forklift puncture. No soil, drains or waterways were reportedly impacted by the release. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents, hand tools and the proper PPE. The damaged drum was overpacked and staged onsite per RRTS terminal personnel instructions. All other waste generated from this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon metal drum which was taken offsite and staged at the contractor’s facility pending proper disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was laying sideways on the ground when spotted leaking. Package was immediately put into a tote and taken to a QA center for further inspection. DescribePack: The package was laying in the side even though it had orientation arrows, however it was not marked as a hazmat. The out packaging seemed fine but there was little inner packaging to prevent the can of paint from sliding around inside the box. There was a dent on the side of the can the caused the clips to pop off and open the lid to open and leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a tote in the upright position according to the orientation arrows

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-10
  • City: MORAINE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS USA INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A drum of waste was punctured during the unloading of a skid of drums. Estimating about 15-20 gallons of waste profile J155-0748 (waste flammable liquid) released from the bottom of the drum that was being unloaded from the rear of a trailer at the dock 3. The drum was punctured by the fork when the tip of the fork went between the pallet slats and punctured the bottom of the drum. The drum was positioned in the 2nd row from the end of the trailer load. Waste released to the soil below the dock. Contracted response and cleanup company was called and cleaned up the soil and placed in 2 drums. There were no injuries nor exposures. No waterways nor drains were impacted.

  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XCO experienced a UN1760 "Delpac 2020" release from a 55-gallon poly drum due to improper loading. ERTS dispatched contractor to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-ounces of product released to the drum only due to improper loading; the drum fell over in transit. The drum was wiped down and re-secured for transit. The waste was placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: PVS Transportation driver was scheduled to deliver a shipment of Sulfuric Acid 93% to Guardian Lima, OH. THe driver arrived on site was directed to the unloading location, and got his bill of lading signed. The driver proceeded to hook up to the unloading connection and the transfer process began. During the transfer process approximately 30 gallons of Sulfuric Acid 93% was released out of the fitting on the unloading connection. The product released was contained, confined, and pumped back into the customer's system.

  • Description: Driver of tractor trailer(tanker) was heading northbound on State Route 4 in Milford Center, OH. The roadway was covered with snow and there was ice underneath that caused the tractor trailer to slide off the road to the right and overturn. The police and fire department arrived on the scene. There was no package failure or release.>\ A Plug Power emergency response team was immediately assigned to the incident to oversee the uprighting of the tractor and trailer. The tractor and trailer were both towed to a safe location.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. Tractor-trailer unit lose control due to slippery road conditions and went off of the roadway into the center median. The Harmony Township Fire Department responded to assess the site. Due to weather conditions first responders did not deploy containment boom and absorbent material. Green Charge, Inc. was dispastched to perform a site investigation. Green Charge, Inc. assess the site and determined that the free liquid impacted a nearby drain which empties into a nearby creek. Green Charge set up absorbent boom in the impacted creek to prevent further migration of the diesel fuel. The site was secured pending additional boom inspection and site excavation on a later date.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the PM sort operations at the FedEx Express ramp in Columbus, OH a fiberboard box was observed leaking suspected undeclared DG. Further investigation indicated the box contained a bottle of UN2031, Nitric acid, 8, II which the inner contents leaked out into the outer packaging. There were no dangerous goods markings or labels on the packaging, and no Shippers Declaration for Dangerous Goods was offered with the shipment. Following spill cleanup, the involved package was placed inside of a salvage drum and help pending further disposition instructions.

  • Description: On January 30, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of brake cleaner (UN1993) was punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services LC, who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted surface. FCE personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect the product, then containerized all brake cleaner-impacted material in one (1) 85-gallon overpack for disposal.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-17
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 17, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of virgin lacquer thinner (UN1992) experiences a compromised bottom seal and released approximately two (2) gallons of product the the terminal surface. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Service, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin LIne Environmental (TLE) to perform the necessary corrective actions. TLE personnel patched the damaged drum and utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface. TLE then containerized all virgin lacquer thinner-impacted material into one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2023010236
item.description:
Report E-2023010236

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-06
  • City: Westchester
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Veolia North America
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 1/5/2023 trailer DT314 was loaded with sulfur trioxide at the Veolia Fort Hill Plant in North Bend OH, to be transported on 1/6/2023 to a customer, Pilot Chemical in Middletown OH. When the trailer departed Fort Hill on 1/6/2023, nothing abnormal was observed by the site, the driver, or site security. The trailer was being transported by Hazmat Enviromental LLC. Shortly after the trailer had left the Fort Hill site enroute to the customer, the driver transporting trailer DT314 observed what was described as a haze coming from the covered crash box of the trailer when the driver slowed or stopped. The driver indicated the haze was nearly unnoticeable while the trailer was in transit. This observation by the driver occurred at approximately 30 minutes after departing Fort Hill. The driver notified his dispatch and the Fort Hill Plant Site. The carrier notified Chemtrec per Veolia procedure. The driver immediately returned to the Fort Hill Site with the trailer. The trailer was returned to the Fort Hill site at 1010. The exact time duration of the vapor release is unknown, but based on the driver's observation, it is estimated to have been approximately 45 minutes to 1 hour. The Fort Hill site observed a light acid mist (vapor / fumes) coming from the WECO Cap of the liquid loading line. Upon further inspection it was determined the gasket sealing the WECO Cap to the liquid line valve spool, was misaligned and did not create a sufficient seal. This closure (the WECO Cap) is the secondary closure outside of the loading liquid line valve and outside of the tankers primary closure system. Sulfur Trioxide residue was present in this spool section, above the liquid line valve, and below the installed WECO Cap. With the gasket misaligned, it is suspected this allowed that minimal residue to absorb moisture in the air and then omit visible vapor / fumes. The gasket sealing surfaces were cleaned, inspected, and the gasket replaced at the Fort Hill Plant. The trailer was re-inspected, and the delivery was later made without incident.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 22, 2022, six (6) 50-pound bags of Mesto Beads 2048 (UN3262) were punctured by a faulty skid steer from the shipping company and released approximately five (5) pounds of product to the trailer interior and immediate pallets. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services LC, who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to assess and remediate the site as necessary. TLE personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted trailer and pallets, then containerized all UN3262-impacted material in three (3) 35-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services LC, who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to perform the necessary corrective actions. TLE personnel utilized granular absorbents, degreasing agents, absorbent pads, and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized all UN3149-impacted material in one (1) 5-gallon pail and one (1) 35-gallon drum for disposal.

ERTS dispatched contractors for cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 4' x 8' area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were worked into the impacted area. The damaged jug, impacted cardboard, and all cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 11/30, DG Admin received a call regarding an unmarked package that was suspected of containing aerosol cans, due to the noise it made when it was moved. There were no outer markings indicating that the package contained dangerous goods. DG Admin instructed the agent to open the package and they found aerosol cans inside the package. Upon further investigation the shipper was contacted earlier about picking up the package since it was suspected of containing dangerous goods and they refused. DG Admin instructed the station to hold the package until further disposition.

  • Description: The trailer was located at Veolia's 10-day transfer facility in Dayton, OH on it's way to it's final destination. The trailer was parked next to the warehouse when during routine walk around inspection, a Veolia employee found the trailer with several small puddles underneath. The trailer was moved to the dock to be unloaded in order to find the faulty container. A drum was discovered with a hole in the bottom. The drum was removed from the trailer and over packed into salvage drum for continued transportation.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-17
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO terminal XCO reports a release of 6 cups of "California 2 Shimmer" (UN1866) from a 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture inside of the trailer. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 5' x 5' area of the trailer floor due to a puncture. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal drum. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted areas and collected into another 85-gallon metal drum. The waste was left onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2022110455

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-10
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 11, 2022, one (1) five-gallon bucket of oxidizing liquid corrosive (UN3098) was punctured by a nail and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the loading dock floor and wooden pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to complete the necessary corrective actions. TLE personnel utilized neutralizing agent and absorbent pads to remediate the impacted surfaces, then containerized all UN3098-impacted material into one (1) 35-gallon drum for disposal. The crew also collected the damaged bucket in one (1) additional 35-gallon drum for disposal and repalletized the non-damaged cargo for continued shipping.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-05
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0207 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XCN. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of Para11045a UN1268 was released from a 330-gallon plastic tote due to being crushed. The release impacted the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. At 0405 ET, First Call Environmental (FCE) arrived onsite and advised they did not observe a release. Crew conducted a tote transfer of the material from the damaged tote into a new one. The damage tote was then cut up and containerized into an 85 gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2022110664

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-28
  • City: STOW
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HOC TRANSPORT COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 28, 2022, at 0524 ET, HOC Transport reported a tanker rollover of a 9,000 gallon tanker unit, which released 8,500 gallons of UN1203 "Unleaded Gasoline" from the tanker onto the roadway and roadside soil. The tanker and all product exploded and caught fire causing all the product to burn up along with the tanker. The driver reportedly passed away and the roadway was closed. The fire department put out the fire and washed all the remains of the accident with water on the road. Interstate Towing arrived onsite to clean up the remaining impacts and debris, approximately 10-gallons of mixed motor oil and gasoline, asphalt ciders were cleaned up on the shoulder. Interstate Towing was advised by HOC Transport to conduct a 1-inch surface scrape as needed.

item.title: Report I-2022120025
item.description:
Report I-2022120025

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-05
  • City: Youngstown
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THIS PACKAGE WAS FOUND TO HAVE A RATTLING SOUND. IT HAD NOT BEEN OFFERED BY THE SHIPPER WITH ANY DG MARKS, LABELS, NOR A SHIPPER’S DECLARATION. THE PACKAGE WAS OPENED BY MANAGEMENT AND INSIDE WAS AN AEROSOL CAN OF DELTA FOREMOST 2038 TFE ALL PURPOSE LUBRICANT WHICH SAID EXTREMELY FLAMMABLE ON IT. THIS IS UNDECLARED/HIDDEN DG, UN 1950, AEROSOLS FLAMMABLE, DIVISION 2.1, FLAMMABLE GAS. THE FAA WAS NOTIFIED VIA EMAIL AND PHOTOS WERE SENT. THE PACKAGE ALSO INCLUDED SOME NONHAZARDOUS EPOXY. THE PACKAGE WAS HELD PENDING FAA INVESTIGATION.

item.title: Report E-2022110563
item.description:
Report E-2022110563

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-25
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 25, 2022 at 0818, personnel in the CSXT QueensGate Yard discovered GATX 24969, a residue tank car of Sodium Methylate, leaking from the Vacuum Relief Valve (VRV) on top of the car. The car was isolated and The Louis Dreyfus Company, the National Response Center, and CHEMTREC were notified. CHEMTREC Report #2022-10-26-00219. EnviroServe, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and located GATX24969 with the leaking VRV. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper Janelle Sexter 888-381-0760. Contractor personnel cleaned the Sodium Methylate residue from the tank car decontaminating this area on top of the car. The leak was secured and Home Shop Do Not Load decals were affixed to both sides of the car. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 not required. Cause Code:100 NARRI:200

  • Description: 1. X-2022110569 SequenceEvent: This package was discovered in our QA cage leaking. The package was placed in a red hazmat bin lined with plastic hazmat bag for inspection. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a yellow salvage drum lined with a plastic hazmat bag 2. X-2022110570 SequenceEvent: This package was discovered leaking at our QA cage. It was placed in a red hazmat bin lined with a clear plastic hazmat bag for inspection. DescribePack: The bottles inside the box were all wet. The caps were taped and loose and caused internal leakage. The bottles appeared to be overfilled, but impossible to determine. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a yellow salvage drum lined with a clear plastic hazmat bag

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came off truck and was spotted as leaking, upon inspection from me, i noticed there was poor packaging inside the box. The poor packaging led to easy damage to the 6 containers inside the box. The sulfuric acid on 1 of the 6 gallon containers was leaking out and got on all other 5 gallon containers. The package was deemed damaged and was put aside for HESS, ISF, and DPR DescribePack: Package failure came from seem on caps, this was not on correctly from manufacture. Hole size was not noticeable and probably a pin sized hole that caused leakage. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Box was put in one of the Fedex Hazardous waste buckets to prevent leakage on floor.

  • Description: On October 27, 2022, one (1) 30-gallon drum of Potassium Hydroxide was punctured by a nail and released approximately 2.7 pounds of product to the trailer interior and concrete beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from US Ecology (USE) to complete the necessary corrective actions. USE personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized the damaged drum and all UN3266-impacted material into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2022120353

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-02
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: COCA COLA CONSOLIDATED
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 2, 2022, at 1616 ET, Coca-Cola Consolidated reported 170-gallons of UN1824 "Advantis 330" released from a tanker trailer impacting asphalt and a storm drain. HEPACO was dispatched to the site to perform clean-up activities. On September 2, 2022, at 1800 ET, HEPACO personnel arrived on site and estimated 150-gallons of product was released and impacted an area 10-feet (ft.) by 15-ft. of concrete drive/loading dock and a storm drain. HEPACO applied a citric acid neutralizer, pad and granular absorbents to absorb and solidify the impacted areas, collected, containerized in a 55-gallon poly drum, and transported the waste offsite for disposal. HEPACO utilized a vacuum truck to recover the released material from the storm drain catch basin followed by a hot water flushing of the drain to recover residual impacts. Approximately 200-gallons of liquids were recovered and transported offsite for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2022100424
item.description:
Report E-2022100424

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-06
  • City: LORE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SPECTRUM INDUSTRIAL
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver reported to Origin Facility (generator). Once on-site made contact with provided site contact and was guided into the building. Hoses were connected to tanks designated by contact and material was pumped on into tanker. After completion of load and shipping documents, driver departed facility for Envirite of OH for offload. A long the route, driver stopped at gas station to use restroom and grab breakfast. When he was checking out, the attendant asked if he was in tanker and that is was leaking (a small hole had developed on the driver side rear of the tanker). Driver immediately went to the truck and deployed spill kit (additional grabbed material from gas station). Driver then made call to Emergency # listed on manifest. A resulting call back stated that a tanker/crew would be coming to assist with offload. County FD arrived on scene and driver provided them copy of manifest and ERG book. FD contacted Utility Commission to bring in dirt/sand to contain the area directly around the tank. A call was made by operations to US Ecology (EQ) to see if they were mobilizing their tanker down to the site to assist (they did not receive any call). It was later determined that the ER # listed on the manifest was for the generator and they had no means to assist. Several emergency response vendors/Industrial vendors in the area were contacted and Hepaco ended up being the quickest to get on scene.

item.title: Report E-2022100052
item.description:
Report E-2022100052

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-16
  • City: WOOSTER
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HOC TRANSPORT COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 16, 2022, at 0514 ET, HOC Transport reported UN3295 "Natural Gasoline" unknown amount from a cargo tanker due to being involved in an accident and rolled over. ERTS dispatched HEPACO for all onsite clean up operations. On September 16, 2022, at 0705 ET, HEPACO arrived onsite and determined there were two punctures approximately 1/2-inch in diameter and 2-inches by 3-inches in the tanker. The New Pittsburgh Fire Department removed the driver from the truck and sprayed fire fighting foam for suppression. Following the transfer of approximately 1,913-gallons of natural gasoline from the damaged tanker to a relief tanker, an estimated 6,887-gallons was released. HEPACO reported one impacted storm drain that runs perpendicular to roadway-underneath the east bound lane to the south. The Fire Department installed absorbent boom for precautionary measure, no impacts to surface water. The truck and tanker were removed from the median. HEPACO reported a 100-feet (ft.) by 6-ft. area of median soils and a 250-ft. by between 3 and 8-ft. width of shoulder ditch soils at drain outfall were impacted by the release. HEPACO reported a storm drain that was impacted located in the median and inspected the outfall, located to the south-east bound lane roadway, and found evidence of soil impacts. HEPACO utilized pads to absorb impacts at outfall followed by a high-pressure line jetter/vacuum truck unit from surface drain inside of catch basin and piping system to clean and recover approximately 200-gallons of liquids with vacuum truck. HEPACO utilized absorbent booms and pads in the impacted soil areas, storm drain and outfall to recover impacts, and replaced absorbents for preventative and containment measures pending monitoring and remedial activities (soil excavation). HEPACO collected and containerized all solid waste (absorbents) in a 55-gallon steel drum and transported offsite for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2022090895
item.description:
Report E-2022090895

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-28
  • City: Brewster
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: WHEELING & LAKE ERIE RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When the Brewster Yard Switch crew was switching out there train, the car inspector notice a strong odor from tank car CEWX 607. He notified the yardmaster who had the train crew stop the train and segregate the locomotive from the cars. The Yardmaster then notified myself, John Vergis Hazardous Materials Officer for the WLE. I came out to look at the car and removed protective housing cover seal #1464036 and found that the B end Liquid Valve was iced over. I removed the ice and saw that the valve was leaking around the threads of the valve plug. I tried to tighten the valve and was able to get a quarter turn out of it and then the leak stopped. I then tried to tighten the valve plug and was able to get an additional 3/4 turn out of that. I considered the car secure and released it for transportation. I installed new seal #0000217 on the protective housing lid.

  • Description: On September 13, 2022, one (1) 5-gallon jerrican of organic peroxide (UN3109) was crushed due to a load shift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and the concrete surface below the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to perform the necessary corrective actions. TLE personnel deployed soda ash to the impacted surfaces to neutralize the release. TLE then utilized granular absorbents, hand tools, and absorbent wipes to remediate the impacted surface. All organic peroxide-impacted material was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and left on site.

TLE personnel containerized the two (2) damaged 1-gallon jerricans into one (1) 35-gallon poly-drum.   • Description: On September 8, 2022, one (1) 330-gallon tote containing Isogrip SP 7250S Adhesive (UN3082) was punctured by a load strap and released approximately thirty (30) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to perform the necessary corrective actions. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents and worked them in with hand tools, then containerized all impacted-material into three (3) 55-gallon poly lined drums.

  • Description: On September 7, 2022, one (1) 330-gallon tote of Duraform Trane Gray (paint) leaked approximately one (1) gallon of product to the concrete dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to perform the necessary corrective actions. FCE personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized all impacted-solids to one (1) 5-gallon pail. Virgin product was transferred to a new 330-gallon tote.

FCE utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized all UN3082-impacted solids into one (1) 35-gallon drum. The damaged drum was placed into one (1) 85-gallon overpack for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2022090907
item.description:
Report E-2022090907

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-27
  • City: Akron
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: WHEELING & LAKE ERIE RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0948 Hours, the Brittain Yard Switch Crew noticed tank car TILX 112425 fuming from the top of the car and having a strong odor. They called the Brittain Yard Yardmaster who then called myself, John Vergis Hazardous Materials Officer for the WLE to come out and investigate. When I arrived, I saw that fumes were coming from the fill port and that product was running down the right side of the car. I called Enviroserve out of Canton, OH to come out and mitigate the leak and clean the side of the car along with a small area of ground that had been contaminated from the leaking product. They arrived and removed seal number CM10768 from the fill port lid and when they opened the lid, they found that the gasket was off center, causing the leak. The gasket was in good condition so they centered the gasket on the fill port hole and closed and secured the lid. Enviroserve then installed new seals 4255514,4255541,4255510,4255515 and 4255516. After installing new seals, they cleaned the spilled product from inside of the protective housing and wiped down the right side of the car. They also neutralized the discolored stone on the ground where the product spilled. The car was then released for service at 1600 hrs.

THE OTHER ITEMS IN THE BOX NEEDED TO BE DMP AND MATERIALS ARE IN A GREEN DMP BAG BEING HELD ALSO.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: This package was an Undeclared Hazmat. It was unloaded from the van onto the conveyor belt. The primary sort tower spotted the DOT Diamonds and sent the package down the Chute for QA. The package opened up and leaked out. DescribePack: The four bottles inside all had loose caps that were not taped closed. The bottles were also not packed tight or braced for transportation. This allowed the bottles to jostle around inside the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a red hazmat bin lined with a Damaged Hazardous Materials bag. Upon inspection, the caps were tightened and the packaged was placed in a yellow salvage drum.

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-20
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XCO called in to report a 10 pound spill of UN3253 SODIUM METASILICATE PENTAHYDRATE - UNIFLOÒ 26 from a 2000 pound supersack that was caused by the terminal staff ripping the bag with a skid while unloaded other freight. ERTS dispatched Hepaco to conduct cleanup. Hepaco arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20 pounds of product released to s 4' x 4' area of the trailer floor. The product was swept up and containerized along with all remaining product in the supersack into (6) 55 gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022090242
item.description:
Report E-2022090242

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-12
  • City: Cincinnati
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 08/12/2022, at 0828 hours, personnel in the CSXT Queensgate Terminal discovered SOEX 2827, a residue tank car of Hydrocarbons, Liquid, N.O.S., leaking from the bottom of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper of record, National Response Center, and Ohio EPA were notified. (CHEMTREC Report #2022-0812-00133). HEPACO, LLC, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found an active leak from the bottom outlet valve operating handle packing gland. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the consignee, Tim Langford of Shell. Contractor personnel secured the release by tightening the bottom outlet valve packing gland nut. The leak was secured and the car was released for transport. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 is not required. Cause Code: 533 NARRI: 40

  • Description: LEAKING PACKAGE DISCOVERED AT BOXLINE 4. AFTER LOOKING FOR THE CAUSE OF LEAK, A COOLANT WAS THE LEAKING ITEM BUT THERE WERE 5 VARIOUS AEROSOL CANS IN THE PACKAGE ALSO. THERE WERE NO MARKINGS ON THE OUTER BOX INDICATING THE PACKAGE CONTAINED AEROSOLS. HAZARDOUS MATERIAL SUPPORT CENER WAS CONTACTED AND PICTURES AND APPROPRIATE INFORMATION WERE SENT TO HMSC. THE COOLANT WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP SINCE IT WAS LEAKING. PACKAGE WILL BE HELD UNTIL AUTHORIZED FOR CLEARANCE.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 19, 2022, eight (8) 1-gallon jerricans containing lacquer thinner (UN1263) toppled during transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and asphalt beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to perform the necessary corrective actions. FCE personnel drummed the damaged jerricans into one (1) 55-gallon drum, then utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface. All lacquer thinner-impacted material was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • City: COLUMBIANA

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 1, 2022, one (1) 15-gallon container of Hypochlorite Solution 12.5% (UN1791) was punctured by a nail during loading and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior, concrete surface of loading dock, and asphalt surfaces beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to perform the necessary corrective actions. ES containerized the damaged container, Hypochlorite Solution 12.5% impacted material, and container with free product into three (3) 30-gallon drums. The crew then utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface.

  • Description: On August 1, 2022, one (1) 275-gallon tote of NA1760 (contains sodium hydroxide) released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer floor due to an improperly installed cap. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to perform the necessary corrective actions. TLE personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then transferred the remaining virgin product to a new 275-gallon tote and containerized all sodium hydroxide impacted material into one (1) 5-gallon pail.

item.title: Report I-2022100244
item.description:
Report I-2022100244

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-08
  • City: Columbus
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: This package was discovered to be leaking during the sort. Upon inspection of the contents it appeared to be a re-used box with one 1 gallon paint can inside wrapped in plastic. The can leaked from the lid. The inner paint can had Globally Harmonized System (GHS) labels of flammable, exclamation point and health hazard as well as an environmentally hazard mark. The product is a BASF 285-02 low VOC transparent sealer. The manufacturer’s Safety Data Sheet (SDS) lists a flash point of minus 18 degrees Celsius. Section 14 of the SDS lists the identification/classification as UN 1263, Paint, 3, Packing Group II for the IATA/ICAO air transport regulations. As the shipper had not offered the shipment with any DG markings, labels nor a shipper’s declaration, it is undeclared/hidden dangerous goods. The FAA was notified via email and photos sent. The package was held pending FAA investigation until they released it.

item.title: Report E-2022081259
item.description:
Report E-2022081259

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-27
  • City: Cincinnati
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/27/2022, at 1925 hours, personnel in the CSXT Queensgate Terminal discovered TILX 111596, a loaded tank car of Hydrochloric Acid, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, National Response Center, and Ohio EPA were notified. (CHEMTREC Report #2022-0803-00215). Joseph Taylor and Ryan Godsey, CSX Managers of Hazardous Materials were dispatched to the scene and discovered the liquid eduction line primary closure flange was improperly secured - 1 of 4 securement studs were observed with one missing securement nut. Additionally, it was determined a contributing factor to the release of lading was due to pressure in the outage / vapor space that resulted in material elevating through the liquid eduction line and past the improperly secured closure. The CSX Managers relieved the vapor pressure by opening the vapor valve and the release was immediately stopped, to which the primary closure was then secured. Enviroserve, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and assisted with the cleanup of all spilled material to the ground, and decontaminated all exterior surfaces of the car from residue lading. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper Mr. Doug Nestler of Univar Solutions, phone (408) 221-4964. Because of the significance of the release, an approved Mobile Repair Unit will replace all studs on the liquid line primary closure before the car is released to continue in transportation. This incident did require a special switching move. 7.1 is not required. Cause Code: 243 NARRI: 100

item.title: Report E-2022081107
item.description:
Report E-2022081107

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-04
  • City: Walbridge
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/04/2022, at 0453 hours, personnel in the CSXT Walbridge, OH Yard observed and odor from GATX 66084, a loaded tank car of Isobutylene. The car was isolated and the shipper, National Response Center, and Ohio EPA were notified. (CHEMTREC Report #2022-0704-00017). Specialized Professional Services, Inc., a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found an active vapor release from the thermometer well. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper's representative, Mr. Art Board, IV, phone 713-857-0471. Because the release occurred through the thermometer well, a Midland Emergency Response Kit was installed and the tank car was monitored daily in order to coordinate a receiving car. GATX 66084 contents were successfully transferred on 7/14/2022, and cleaned and purged on 7/15/2022, thus securing the release. This incident did not require a special switching move. Cause Code: NARRI:525

  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XCO reported 2.5-gallons of UN1760 "Sure Klean® Heavy Duty Concrete Cleaner" released impacting the trailer floor and parking lot below from a 2.5-gallon poly jug due to a load shift. ERTS dispatched HEPACO to perform all onsite clean up operations. At 0030 ET, HEPACO arrived on-site and confirmed approximately 2.5-gallons of product released affecting a 5’ x 10” area of the trailer floor/concrete parking lot. HEPACO collected and containerized the damaged jug and all clean-up debris into (1) 55-gallons poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal XCN reported UN1760 "Ferrous Chloride" released 30-gallons impacting the trailer floor and asphalt yard due to the metal cage pinching the 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched First Call Environmental to perform all onsite clean up operations. First Call personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately (30)-gallons of product released affecting half of the trailer floor/asphalt below. First call transferred all salvageable product into a new tote and collected and containerized all clean-up debris into three (3) 55-gallons metal drums. Contractors departed the site with all waste.

item.title: Report E-2022080746
item.description:
Report E-2022080746

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-18
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0612 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (XCN) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to unknown reasons, an unknown amount of Nitrogen, refrigerated liquid (Hazardous - UN1977) was released from a 336 pound Dewar. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the OS&D dock and had been seeping out over the weekend. The terminal requested a contractor out to inspect the container to ensure procedure to be taken to stop the seeping is adhered to. ERTS dispatched Hepaco to conduct the assessment. At 0800 ET Hepaco responded and found one Dewar with 25 pounds of pressure still on it. Crew instructed the XPO site to let it bleed off for another 24 hours and when it read 0 PSI it is safe for transport. Hepaco found no other safety risk with the Dewar and advised the same. Crew departed site with no waste generated.

item.title: Report E-2022080268
item.description:
Report E-2022080268

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-26
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 26, 2022, one (1) 55-gallon drum of Purple Rush was punctured by a skid nail and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer floor and concrete surface beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to perform the necessary corrective actions. TLE personnel overpacked the damaged drum, then utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surfaces.

item.title: Report E-2022080250
item.description:
Report E-2022080250

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T21:10:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-25
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 25, 2022, one (1) 330-gallon tote of Magnitek Y120 WM (contains petroleum distillates) released approximately six (6) gallons of product to the concrete loading dock due to a missing valve cap. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to perform the necessary corrective actions. TLE personnel utilized granular absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted surface, then replaced the cap and closed the valve.

  • Description: On July 21, 2022, one (1) box containing 1-gallon bottles of Muriatic Acid incurred damage during transit. As a result, one (1) bottle was punctured and released approximately two (2) pounds of product to the trailer interior, concrete loading dock, and box exterior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC, who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to perform the necessary corrective action. ES personnel neutralized, then containerized all free product and impacted debris into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

  • Description: July 1, 2022, a metal tote of hazardous, UN1219, Isopropyl Alcohol, 3, PG II had a small pinhole in the bottom of the metal tote causing a release.
